questions.question_text: What is the ping response to a transmitted echo that needed to be fragmented and fragmentation was not allowed?

discussion.content: Returns MMMM so, B is correct answer

B
Bandwidth command not support in CoPP

choices.C: Cisco routers lack the support for protecting the control plane
choices.A: The router license is missing in order to configure the policy map
choices.B: The bandwidth command is not supported for policy maps configured for CoPP
choices.D: The service policy should be configured for the output direction B

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit. A large number of TCP sessions attempting to connect to a router cause memory leakage and the router to hang. During troubleshooting the client configures a service policy and applies it to the control plane in the error shown. What is the root cause of this error message?
//IMG//

choices.C: The tunnel is configured with the wrong encapsulation.
choices.A: The tunnel destination interface is flapping, which causes the tunnel to go up and down.
choices.D: The tunnel destination is intermittently reachable via multiple routing protocols.
choices.B: The tunnel source interface is in an up/down state and the tunnel destination is recursively routing as a result.

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit. Which statement indicates a cause for Tunnel0's connection failure?
//IMG//

discussion.content:
ABD
With the p2p GRE over IPsec solution, all traffic between sites is encapsulated in a p2p GRE packet before the encryption process, simplifying the access control list used in the crypto map statements. The crypto map statements need only one line permitting GRE (IP Protocol 47).
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/solutions/Enterprise/WAN_and_MAN/P2P_GRE_IPSec/P2P_GRE/2_p2pGRE_Phase2.html

questions.question_text: Which three features are benefits of using GRE tunnels in conjunction with IPsec for building site-to-site VPNs? (Choose three.)

choices.A: allows dynamic routing over the tunnel
choices.E: uses Virtual Tunnel Interface (VTI) to simplify the IPsec VPN configuration
choices.C: reduces IPsec headers overhead since tunnel mode is used
choices.D: simplifies the ACL used in the crypto map
choices.B: supports multi-protocol (non-IP) traffic over the tunnel

questions.question_text: When troubleshooting recursive routing issues with GRE tunnels, which three actions resolve the issue? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
CDE
Recursive routing means there are preferred route to the tunnel destination through the tunnel itself

choices.E: Change the tunnel source or destination interface
choices.D: Remove the network advertisements from the routing protocols
choices.F: If using OSPF to peer across the tunnel, use EIGRP instead
choices.A: Remove the configuration on the tunnel interface and reconfigure
choices.B: Perform shut and no shut commands on the tunnel interface
choices.C: Add static routes for the tunnel source and destination
